title: Introduction to Figma
description: Getting started with Figma, understanding the interface, and setting up your first project

steps.title: Create a Figma Account
steps.instruction: Go to www.figma.com, click 'Get started', enter your details, and complete a quick verification activity
steps.finished_criteria: The Figma dashboard appears with a few onboarding questions

steps.title: Set up a New Project
steps.instruction: Click on 'Get started' and follow the onboarding questions to create a new project file
steps.finished_criteria: A new project file opens with some example designs and a blank canvas

steps.title: Explore the Figma Interface
steps.instruction: Take a tour of the Figma interface by clicking on the 'Tour the interface' option in the help menu
steps.finished_criteria: The Figma interface tour starts, highlighting key features and tools

steps.title: Create a New Frame
steps.instruction: Click on the 'Frame' tool in the toolbar and drag it onto the canvas to create a new frame
steps.finished_criteria: A new frame appears on the canvas with a blue border

steps.title: Add a Rectangle Layer
steps.instruction: Click on the 'Rectangle' tool in the toolbar and drag it onto the frame to create a new rectangle layer
steps.finished_criteria: A blue rectangle appears on the canvas inside the frame

steps.title: Enable Rulers and Add a Guide
steps.instruction: Go to the main menu, hover over 'View', and select 'Rulers' to enable rulers, then click and drag on the horizontal or vertical ruler to add a new guide
steps.finished_criteria: The rulers appear on the canvas and a new guide is added, indicated by a dotted line

steps.title: View Distances and Redline Distances
steps.instruction: Hold Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) and click and drag out a guide to view distances, then select a frame and view the redline distances between the guide and objects in the frame
steps.finished_criteria: The distance between the guide and the frame is displayed in pixels, and the redline distances appear between the guide and objects in the frame

title: Design Fundamentals
description: Learning the basics of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout in Figma

steps.title: Create a New Frame
steps.instruction: Go to the Figma interface, click on the 'Frame' tool, and drag it onto the canvas to create a new frame
steps.finished_criteria: A new frame named Frame 1 appears on the canvas

steps.title: Enable Rulers
steps.instruction: Open the Main menu, hover over View, and select Rulers to enable rulers on the canvas
steps.finished_criteria: Rulers appear on the top and left side of the canvas

steps.title: Add a Guide to the Canvas
steps.instruction: Click and drag on the horizontal or vertical ruler to pull a guide onto the canvas
steps.finished_criteria: A dotted line appears on the canvas, indicating the position of the guide

steps.title: Create a New Text Layer
steps.instruction: Click on the 'Text' tool and click on the canvas to create a new text layer
steps.finished_criteria: A new text layer appears on the canvas with a cursor blinking inside it

steps.title: Apply a Font to the Text Layer
steps.instruction: Select the text layer, go to the 'Text' properties panel, and select a font from the font menu
steps.finished_criteria: The text layer displays the selected font

steps.title: Use the Arrange and Align Commands
steps.instruction: Select the frame and text layer, go to the 'Arrange' menu, and select 'Align Horizontal Centers' to align the text layer with the frame
steps.finished_criteria: The text layer is centered horizontally within the frame

steps.title: Use Auto Layout
steps.instruction: Select the frame, go to the 'Layout' menu, and toggle on 'Auto Layout' to enable auto layout for the frame
steps.finished_criteria: The frame's layout is updated to use auto layout, and the text layer is resized accordingly

title: Working with Frames and Layers
description: Understanding how to create, manage, and organize frames and layers in Figma to build complex designs

steps.title: Enable Rulers
steps.instruction: Open the Main menu, hover over View, and select Rulers to enable rulers on the canvas.
steps.finished_criteria: The rulers appear on the top and left side of the canvas

steps.title: Create a New Frame
steps.instruction: Click and drag on the canvas to create a new frame.
steps.finished_criteria: A new frame appears on the canvas with a blue border

steps.title: Add a Guide to the Canvas
steps.instruction: Click and drag on the horizontal or vertical ruler to pull a guide onto the canvas.
steps.finished_criteria: A dotted line appears on the canvas, indicating the guide's position

steps.title: Create a New Layer
steps.instruction: Use the toolbar to create a new layer, such as a rectangle or text layer, inside the frame.
steps.finished_criteria: A new layer appears inside the frame, visible in the layers panel

steps.title: Arrange and Align Layers
steps.instruction: Use the Arrange and Align commands to position the new layer within the frame.
steps.finished_criteria: The layer is positioned and aligned within the frame, as indicated by the canvas and layers panel

steps.title: Use Auto Layout
steps.instruction: Toggle on auto layout in the design to automatically arrange and align layers.
steps.finished_criteria: The layers are automatically arranged and aligned within the frame, as indicated by the canvas and layers panel

steps.title: View Distances and Redlines
steps.instruction: Hold Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) and click and drag out a guide to view distances and redlines between the guide and objects in the frame.
steps.finished_criteria: The distance between the guide and objects in the frame is displayed, along with redlines indicating the measurements

steps.instruction: Go to the Prototype tab and create a new prototype by clicking the + button.

steps.title: Link Frames in the Prototype
steps.instruction: Drag a connection from one frame to another to link them in the prototype.
steps.finished_criteria: A blue line appears, connecting the two frames, indicating a new prototype connection
